body_html: What would SELoss-acronym stand for? Mean Squared Error is well known acronym in stat/ml-community so it makes sense. Myself I feel that once you start passing non-default parameters to torch.nn.MSELoss(size_average=None, reduce=None, reduction='elementwise_mean') it has already lost its usefulness, i.e reduced code-complexity and readability.
body_text: What would SELoss-acronym stand for? Mean Squared Error is well known acronym in stat/ml-community so it makes sense. Myself I feel that once you start passing non-default parameters to torch.nn.MSELoss(size_average=None, reduce=None, reduction='elementwise_mean') it has already lost its usefulness, i.e reduced code-complexity and readability.
body: What would `SELoss`-acronym stand for? Mean Squared Error is well known acronym in stat/ml-community so it makes sense. Myself I feel that once you start passing non-default parameters to `torch.nn.MSELoss(size_average=None, reduce=None, reduction='elementwise_mean')` it has already lost its usefulness, i.e reduced code-complexity and readability.
